work.summary: As the first front end developer at TopstepTrader, collaborate cross-departmentally to create reusable front end assets, maintain a high standard of front end focussed code and architecture, orchestrate testing and data analysis, and automate marketing processes.
highlights: Architected micro frontend solution to enable migration from an Angular 2 monolith into a leaner, React solution
Led front end engineering efforts across a variety of stacks
Designed, developed, and implemented a reusable component library to convert modern components into static, cross-browser-ready artifacts
Improved first paint time 300% through a site migration from Wordpress to a faster Node and Gulp solution
Led front end developer hiring by creating technical tests and interview processes
Administrated tracking pixels, analytics solutions, and attribution systems to monitor all digital marketing efforts

work.summary: Working on the university website gave me the opportunity to write custom features for faculty, teach sessions on using our CMS, and help lead an holistic SEO initiative.
highlights: Authored custom web pages, forms, and apps for university departments
Designed and authored Python applications to automate bottlenecks in the teamâ€™s recurring workflows
Organized and led classes on basic HTML, content creation, and best UI/UX practices for >200 users

work.summary: I interned with MacUpdate for two consecutive summers. During my first internship, I was able to lead an initiative in bringing responsive design to the site for the first time. My second summer with MacUpdate, I led an SEO initiative improving page performance and on-page SEO.
highlights: Designed and implemented a front end build process, which fully automated front end asset builds and reduced average page size by 15%, or ~250KB per page
Organized an SEO audit and action plan, resulting in an organic search increase of 20%, or 30k+ sessions weekly
Introduced the site's first responsive design with a responsive navigation bar and footer
Developed a customizable, metadata-driven automatic email system, allowing better targeted email campaigns

publications.name: WAILto
publications.summary: WAILto (or What Am I Listening To) is a way to analyze your own music listening trends and history.

publications.name: personaList
publications.summary: With personaList, you can comment up every song in your Spotify playlist. Pages are dynamically generated with JavaScript to show Spotify API data.

publications.name: Git Flow
publications.summary: Git Flow is an interactive git tutorial that walks users through a git workflow via a step-by-step flowchart.
